metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9473 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.Description:
In ytnef 1.9.2, the TNEFFillMapi function in lib/ytnef.c allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9473` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libytnef0 - 1.9.3-1
ytnef-tools - 1.9.3-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libytnef package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.9.3-1').
